HomePage.h1: Osteopath in Lisbon – Camille Labasse, D.O
HomePage.intro: Osteopathy has its unique yet universal, scientific and philosophical, human and naturalistic way of conceiving the human being.
HomePage.welcome: Welcome to the osteopathic clinic of Camille Labasse D.O !
HomePage.h2_osteopathy: Osteopathy: a human and natural approach

OsteopathyPage.text_understand: Osteopathy diagnoses and treats mobility dysfunctions of body tissues that alter the state of health, within a general understanding of the human being. It is adapted for everyone: from babies to seniors, athletes, pregnant women, people with disabilities or chronic pathologies... The osteopathic treatment, in addition to helping solving the symptom and its cause, regulate the nervous system, reset and profoundly recharge the body.
OsteopathyPage.text_functional:
Treats functional disorders of the human body :
Musculoskeletal pain, headaches, positional vertigo, concentration disorders, tinnitus, trauma sequelae, digestive disorders, genito-urinary and menstrual disorders, recurrent infections, fatigue, stress, insomnia...

Each consultation aims to restore the body's natural balance for lasting relief.
OsteopathyPage.text_pathologies:
Accompanies the symptomatology of pathologies such as: fibromyalgia, osteoarthritis, Crohn's disease, irritable bowel syndrome, asthma, depression, autoimmune or oncological diseases...

The osteopathic approach offers complementary support to improve quality of life and alleviate symptoms.
OsteopathyPage.text_bio:
Camille is an accredited and exclusive osteopath. She studied 5 years full time in France, within an education that meets the european standards of osteopathy. 
She is specialized in functional techniques, also known as indirects and gentle. She keeps on studying ad learning with the best teachers, themselves pupils of the first generations of American and British osteopaths, in France: Pierre Tricot, Elisabeth Tissot, Pascal Anselin...

TraumaPage.h1: Biodynamic Osteopathy & Trauma: The Somatic Approach
TraumaPage.h2_why_body: Why does the body store trauma?
TraumaPage.text_intro:
Unresolved and biodynamic osteopathy: a somatic osteopathic approach to trauma

Here, osteopathic touch at the level of the skull regarding brain areas is used to facilitate intimate contact with the unconscious through the body. It is the body that stores, expresses, and releases trauma.
TraumaPage.text_work: In this work, the encounter with what our body holds will allow us to express the emotion that was repressed at key moments of our past, to reprocess memories, to purge the trauma, and to allow our nervous system to lastingly regulate itself.
TraumaPage.text_who: This work is adapted to anyone wishing to deepen their personal development and meet the source of certain disorders (anxiety, relational blockages, chronic stress, physical symptoms that do not find their solutions through classical care).
TraumaPage.h2_role: The role of the body in transformation
TraumaPage.text_role: The body is the key to true transformation.
TraumaPage.cta_question: Ready to start your healing journey?

FAQPage.subtitle: Everything you need to know about osteopathy in Lisbon
FAQPage.a1: Osteopathy is a manual therapeutic approach that aims to restore the body's natural balance. It treats mobility dysfunctions of tissues that can alter health. Learn more about osteopathy.
FAQPage.a2: The number of sessions varies for each person and the nature of the problem. Generally, 1 to 3 sessions are sufficient for acute problems, while chronic issues may require longer follow-up. Each case is evaluated individually during the first consultation.
FAQPage.q3: How much does an osteopathy session cost?
FAQPage.a3: A consultation costs 60€. Reduced rate of 50€ for babies under 1 year and unemployed people. See all rates and book an appointment.
FAQPage.a4: I am not affiliated with any health insurance. However, I provide a detailed invoice that you can submit yourself to your insurance to request partial reimbursement, according to your contract.
FAQPage.q5: For what types of problems can I consult?
FAQPage.a5: Osteopathy treats many disorders: musculoskeletal pain, migraines, digestive disorders, stress, insomnia, vertigo, tinnitus, menstrual disorders, and much more. Discover all treated disorders.
FAQPage.q6: Is osteopathy suitable for babies and pregnant women?
FAQPage.a6: Yes, absolutely! Osteopathy uses very gentle and safe techniques, perfectly adapted for babies (colic, sleep disorders, plagiocephaly) and pregnant women (lower back pain, childbirth preparation). Learn more about pediatric osteopathy.
FAQPage.q7: How long does a session last?
FAQPage.a7: An osteopathy session lasts approximately 45 minutes to 1 hour. This time allows for a complete assessment, adapted treatment, and personalized advice to prolong the benefits of the session.
FAQPage.q8: Do you also offer work on emotional trauma?
FAQPage.a8: Yes, I offer a specialized somatic approach for releasing physical and emotional trauma. This method uses biodynamic osteopathy to treat post-traumatic stress, anxiety and emotional shocks. Discover the trauma approach.
FAQPage.cta_subtitle: Feel free to contact me for any additional questions
